description: The department of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) has a requirement to assess the geothermal potential of volcanic belts in Western Canada.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
## Electromagnetic Survey Services
### Request for Proposal (RFP)

**Project Overview**
Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) is soliciting proposals for the collection and delivery of high-quality magneto telluric data over Teslin, Yukon. The project aims to assess the geothermal potential of volcanic belts in Western Canada and use natural field electromagnetic (EM) surveys as a lower-cost approach to collect data. A helicopter-borne natural field EM survey is proposed to measure the resistivity of the subsurface to 500m or deeper.

**Scope of Work**

* Conduct a natural field EM survey according to the Detailed Technical Specifications outlined in the Statement of Work
* Deliver field data to the Technical Authority (TA) for analysis
* Complete a 220 line-km survey over one survey block over Teslin, Yukon

**Project Requirements**

* Assessment of geothermal potential of volcanic belts in Western Canada
* Collection of high-quality magneto telluric data
* Delivery of field data to the Technical Authority (TA)
* Collaboration with NRCan to meet project objectives

**Key Dates**

* Tender Closing Date: June 12, 2023, at 14:00:00 (Local Time)
* Expected Contract Start Date: June 30, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: March 31, 2024

**Procurement Information**

* Solicitation Number: 5000073212
* Amendment Number: 2
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Lowest Price

**Contracting Entity**

* Natural Resources Canada
* 580 Booth Street, Ottawa, ON, K1A 0E8, Canada

**Contact Information**

* Shazeen Dhanani, Contracting Officer
* Phone: (343) 575-6324
* Email: [shazeen.dhanani@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca](mailto:shazeen.dhanani@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca)

**Additional Information**

* The procurement is subject to the Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement (CLCA) with the Teslin Tlingit Council Final Agreement.
* The contractor is expected to collaborate with NRCan to meet the project objectives.
